rsbNotes.title: John 8:21
rsbNotes.text:
8:21 I am going away. Jesus speaks of His death, resurrection, and ascension.

die in your sin. Jesus clearly states the two destinies of humanity. Not all will be saved; some cannot go where Jesus is going. The only way of salvation is to believe (v. 24; 3:16, 18).

rsbNotes.title: John 8:24, 28
rsbNotes.text: 8:24, 28 I am he. Here Jesus applies Old Testament language for Yahweh to Himself (Ex. 3:14; Is. 43:10), an identification that becomes unambiguous in v. 58.

rsbNotes.title: John 8:28
rsbNotes.text: 8:28 lifted up. See note at 3:14.

rsbNotes.title: John 8:30
rsbNotes.text: 8:30 believed in him. From what is said later (vv. 33, 37, 39), it is apparent that their profession was superficial. True believers are those who abide in His word (v. 31). Perseverance distinguishes those who are truly born of God (15:2, 6; 1 John 2:19).
